_comment: Created by ianb on 01/10/2014 11:54:11 using v2.1
title: How has the proportion of Red 1 and 2 calls attended within 8 minutes varied by commissioning region?
analysis_commentary:
The Government requires that 75% of Category A (life-threatening) calls should have be attended within eight minutes.

The proportion of category A calls attended within eight minutes varies at the regional level in a similar manner to the national level, although London has a tendency to more extreme peaks and troughs. Every area has missed the target of attending 75% of Category A calls within eight minutes since May of this year. London's performance has shown a marked fall since March, and in July (the latest month for which data are available) was at the lowest level yet recorded.
